name: Manara
headline: Connecting top Middle East talent to global tech jobs
description: Manara untaps the human potential in the Arab world and helps global tech companies access high-quality, diverse talent. We identify the top software engineers in the region and offer them a last-mile solution to land their dream jobs: interview preparation and referrals.

founders.name: Iliana Montauk, Founder
founders.description: Iliana's passion is untapping human potential. She previously bootstrapped the launch of the first startup accelerator in Gaza - literally during a war. While there, she increased women's participation in pipeline activities from 25% to 49% and ran the largest crowdfunding campaign in the Arab region. She has worked as a senior product manager managing talent at the largest talent marketplace in the world (Upwork) and at Google. She speaks 5 languages and is always trying to make better hummus.

## Testimonials
![](https://manara.tech/hubfs/Profile%20Photo.png)
“I love the flexibility of Manara’s platform and the guidance on what content to study. I had no idea React Native was in such high demand... thanks to Manara I now have my dream remote job!”
Alaa Q.Mobile Engineer5 Years of Experience
![](https://manara.tech/hubfs/Profile%20Photo-1.png)
“The course on prompt engineering and AI was great and the support from the community was phenomenal! At the startup I’m at, they expected me to suddenly become an expert in this domain and I felt intimidated asking my questions anywhere else."
Maryam A.Backend Engineer2 Years of Experience
![](https://manara.tech/hubfs/Profile%20Photo-2.png)
“Really appreciated how the AWS cloud training with Manara was customized to my level. I never had exposure to AWS because it wasn’t available in Saudi Arabia before, now I feel really confident using it in my job."
Mo B.DevOps Engineer3 Years of Experience
## Courses Designed by Silicon Valley Engineers
Manara’s courses are in-demand in the industry.
![](https://manara.tech/hubfs/Small%20Courses.png)

generated_description:
Manara is an innovative company founded in 2020, located in Berkeley, California, and part of the prestigious Y Combinator Batch W21. The company's mission is straightforward yet impactful: connecting top Middle Eastern talent with global tech job opportunities. In the ever-evolving tech landscape, Manara focuses on unlocking the enormous potential within the Arab world, facilitating access for high-quality, diverse candidates to global opportunities in tech.

To achieve this, Manara specializes in refining the skills of aspiring software engineers by offering a “last-mile solution.” This includes personalized interview preparation and exclusive referrals to global tech companies, making it easier for candidates to secure their dream jobs. With a dedicated team of ten and a vision championed by their Group Partner, NaN, Manara has quickly positioned itself as a key player in the ed-tech space.

Their offerings encompass not just job placements but also tailored education. They provide courses designed by Silicon Valley engineers, targeting the needs of both junior engineers and senior data scientists. This involves not just technical training, but also essential preparatory support, like resume reviews and peer interviews—because preparation can be the difference between a good candidate and an exceptional one.

Manara has established a strong community, inviting users to participate in free programs that equip them with skills for the global job market. They emphasize a no-cost approach for their current offerings, with the potential for premium content to emerge in the future.

If you’re looking to navigate the tech landscape as a Middle Eastern engineer or if you’re a company searching for talented individuals, Manara serves as a bridge to connect talent with the opportunities they need.

Check out their more detailed offerings and how to get involved at [manara.tech](http://www.manara.tech).

In summary, Manara is focusing on not just filling roles in tech but enriching the entire workforce by training and empowering candidates from the Middle East to thrive globally.
